citation.article-title: Coprobacillus catenaformis gen. nov., sp. nov., a new genus and species isolated from human feces.

p.s: Description of Coprobacillus catenaformis sp. nov.
Coprobacillus catenaformis (ca.te.na.for'mis. L. n. catena chain; L. adj. formis shaped; M.L. adj. catenaformis, chainlike)
Cells are 0.4 X 1.2-1.7 Î¼m long and in chains.
Cells can be cultivated for 2 days at 37 C on EG agar in an anaerobic jar with 100% CO2.

Cells produce acid from glucose, mannose, galactose, fructose, sucrose, maltose, cellobiose, lactose, trehalose, and salicin but not from arabinose, xylose, rhamnose, ribose, raffinose, melezitose, starch, glycogen, mannitol, sorbitol, inositol, erythritol, esculin, or amygdalin.
Gas formation, indole production, nitrate reduction, gelatin requisition, and H2S production are all negative.
They are nonmotile and inhibited by 20% bile.
DNA G + C content is 32 to 34 mol%.
The type strain of Coprobacillus catenaformis is strain JCM 10604T.
